it just seems pointless to me to be

I used to live in Bradford
there was a bend on the road close to
where I lived there's a bump on the bend
so the hubcaps used to for life the cars
and collect there and when I was walking
by I had to see them fairly regularly
after a while I started thinking about
it thinking about the waste thinking
about the amount of time and effort has
gone into designing these things and
often how in the sunlight they look
really beautiful and so I started to
collect them with an idea of sort of
making something out of them the idea
was to make a suit of armor but I never
got around to it the fish got in the way
I see a lot of detail and within the
hubcaps that reminds me of other things
you know there's like the shapes around
the eyes fins the tails all sorts of
things it's all hand tools it's hacksaw
craft knife you know I usually score and
Bend and cut drill holes and I use
galvanized wire which is sourced from
demolition sites or Skip's galvanized so
that it doesn't rust I kind of make
little staple shapes and bits together
like that when I left Brantford I went
to India for a year and I saw an
enormous amount of poverty there but one
of the things that really struck me was
the fact that everybody used and reused
things so something got broken they
didn't just chuck it away and get a new
one like we often do in the West they
kind of just mended it or changed it
into something else I wanted to kind of
include that idea that concept in my art
somehow realistically I wouldn't really
want to get rid of any of them because I
put a lot of myself into these things
you know but obviously I have to make a
living
I can I can work doing these for the
rest of my life and I won't even make a
dent in the kind of amount stuff there
is out there
